thread.title: Mark Clattenburg makes Premier League U-turn to continue refereeing before Saudi Arabia move
thread.title_full: Mark Clattenburg makes Premier League U-turn to continue refereeing before Saudi Arabia move

author: Alex Richards
title: Mark Clattenburg makes Premier League U-turn to continue refereeing before Saudi Arabia move
text:
Clattenburg's Premier League career is not yet over (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) Share Get     
Mark Clattenburg WILL continue to referee in the Premier League before heading to Saudi Arabia. 
After talks with referee' chief Mike Riley, Clattenburg will now continue to officiate in the top flight before heading to the Middle East. 
The 41-year-old Englishman is widely regarded as one of the finest officials in the world, having taken charge of the finals of Euro 2016 and last season's Champions League and FA Cup. 
But having been linked with a move abroad for some time and on Thursday the Saudi Arabian Football Federation announced he would manage its referees in the country. 
The Professional Game Match Officials Limited (PGMOL) confirmed his departure and it was believed that Clattenburg would NOT continue officiating in England before leaving for his new role. 
But now Clattenburg has reached an agreement to carry on. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
